intro: Aethionema arabicum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in rocky and arid environments. Aethionema arabicum is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
